Articles.Content:
This is going to be a similar space race to the JNSQ race and the Beyond Home race

Here are the basic rules

1. each player can pick a singular mod(or in the case of it being best used when there are more mods e.g NFT, the mods it needs to function)

Mods that are REQUIRED

Gallileos Planet Pack

Grannus Expansion Pack

USI Life Support

MKS(for the hab/home time reqs, and space base parts)

EPL

KSPIE

EVERYONE WILL USE KSP 1.8.1

note, machinery needs can be turned off for MKS, To make it less complex

REQUIRED SETTINGS

Science gain no higher than 100%(because moons have only 3/4 biomes, planets arent much better)

Reentry heating at 100%

MKS-Use machinery off

Kerbal Exp On

 

Here are the goals

Orbit Gael

Land on Iota/Ceti(crewed/uncrewed

Land on a moon(Crewed)

Go to another planet(crewed/uncrewed)

Land on another planet(crewed/uncrewed)

Plant a flag on another planet(Crewed)

Return from another planet(Crewed/Uncrewed)

Construct a space station where kerbals can stay for a MINIMUM OF 6 months (180 kerbal days)

Land on a moon of a gas giant(crewed/uncrewed)

Build a base on another planet, this base must be able to produce Supplies on its own(produces enough supplies for the crew to remain indefinitely, Colony supplies are a secondary goal, if not reachable, kerbals must be able to stay at the base for 4 kerbal years before returning)

Get to Grannus(crewed/uncrewed)

Land on a planet/moon around grannus(crewed/uncrewed)

Plant a flag on a planet around grannus(crewed)

Construct A FULLY SUSTAINABLE BASE(Life supp and colony supplies using MKS)(Crewed)

Have at least 20 kerbals on a planet around grannus(crewed)

Construct a space station around the planet, It will serve to refuel ships around the planet

Build a cargo vessel to be used to go between the planet and it's moon(crewed/uncrewed)

Each Person Will pick a mod and a flag

KSPIE is NOT claimable

Players

KspNerd122 using NFT

 

THE RACE WILL START ON DECEMBER 24 Late entries are allowed, as it is based off of IN GAME TIME
